deity.name: Tempus
deity.title: God of War
deity.symbol: A white lightning bolt

customProperties.Depiction: An old king, sometimes seated, holding a bolt of lightning
customProperties.Worshipers: Citizens, paladins, heroes, kings, soldiers
customProperties.Sacred Places: Temples, shrines, palaces, courts, Mount Hyperius

entries: Tempus is the king of gods, and father to them all. He is strength and wisdom, the balance of kings. He represents civilization itself, law, reason, and justice. Yet when tested, he is wrath, the swift lightning of retribution and the thundering crash of judgment. Like Krytos, he is a god of battle, but represents its nobler side. He is honor, courage, and valor. His are the tactics and strategies that bring victory over strength of arms alone.

deity.name: Asmodaen
deity.title: The Betrayer
deity.symbol: A pair of red swords crossed on a shield

customProperties.Depiction: A mighty male warrior clad in armor, wielding shield and spear
customProperties.Worshipers: Orcs, gladiators, hoplites, mercenaries
customProperties.Sacred Places: Arenas, colosseums, battlefields, Krytan Citadels

entries: Asmodaen is the god of war, glory, and strength. He is in the clash of bronze, the hot blood spilled upon arena sand. Wherever mortals fight and die, Asmodaen lives. He is the god of conflict, battle, and victory. He is the god of bloodlust, fury, and battle madness. Those that worship him seek glory, renown through feats of strength, and to die a good death that will be remembered in tale and song.

deity.name: Hecatontagon
deity.title: God of Destiny
deity.symbol: A dark blue trident

customProperties.Depiction: A human or Scyllaean elf woman holding a trident and a scroll or stone tablet
customProperties.Worshipers: Scyllaean elves, sailors, philosophers, fishermen, explorers, merchants
customProperties.Sacred Places: Lighthouses, harbors, the Acropolis of Ithea

entries: Hecatontagon is the god of knowledge, magic, prophecy, and the sea. He is in the promise of the tide, the warm winds that bring sailors safely home, and the life-giving bounty of the sea. His are the arts of navigation, the stars, divination, arcana, and discovery.

deity.name: Titan
deity.title: God of Chaos
deity.symbol: A volcano

customProperties.Depiction: A dwarf holding a flame
customProperties.Worshipers: Dwarves, craftsmen; masons, bronze smiths, miners, jewelers, and glaziers
customProperties.Sacred Places: Forges and mountain shrines with ever-burning flames

entries: Titan is the god of chaos and unpredictability. He thrives in the ever-changing nature of existence, embracing disorder and upheaval. Those who worship Titan seek to harness the power of chaos and adapt to the tumultuous world around them.

deity.name: Aelindra
deity.title: Goddess of Dreams
deity.symbol: A golden lyre

customProperties.Depiction: A beautiful woman holding a golden lyre
customProperties.Worshipers: Dreamers, scholars, artists, seers, those who seek inspiration
customProperties.Sacred Places: Dreaming groves, libraries, theaters, art galleries

entries: Aelindra is the goddess of dreams and the imagination. She inspires creativity, insight, and visions. Those who look to Aelindra for guidance find themselves blessed with vivid dreams and the ability to tap into their innermost creativity.

deity.name: Arvanador
deity.title: God of the Forge
deity.symbol: A blacksmith's hammer

customProperties.Depiction: A skilled blacksmith crafting a mighty weapon
customProperties.Worshipers: Blacksmiths, artisans, craftsmen, those who seek mastery of their craft
customProperties.Sacred Places: Forges, blacksmith workshops, crafting guilds

entries: Arvanador is the god of the forge and craftsmanship. He embodies the art of blacksmithing and the creation of magnificent weapons and armor. His followers are skilled artisans who seek to master their craft and create legendary items.

deity.name: Xaylene Xeranos
deity.title: God of Merchants
deity.symbol: Scales of justice

customProperties.Depiction: A merchant holding scales and a bag of gold
customProperties.Worshipers: Merchants, traders, negotiators, those seeking prosperity in trade
customProperties.Sacred Places: Marketplaces, trading posts, banks, merchant guilds

entries: Xaylene Xeranos is the god of merchants and commerce. He oversees fair trade, prosperous markets, and the exchange of goods. His followers seek wealth and success in the world of commerce, and they often turn to him for guidance in business endeavors.

deity.name: Leylani
deity.title: Fledgling Goddess of the Moon
deity.symbol: A crescent moon

customProperties.Depiction: A young goddess with a crescent moon in her hair
customProperties.Worshipers: Moon worshipers, druids, those who find solace in the night sky
customProperties.Sacred Places: Moonlit groves, serene lakes under moonlight, lunar observatories

entries: Leylani is the fledgling goddess of the moon, emerging as a symbol of the night sky and its mysteries. Those who revere her find solace in the serene glow of the moon and seek to explore the secrets of the night.

deity.name: Lothwyn
deity.title: Fledgling Goddess of the Moon
deity.symbol: A crescent moon

customProperties.Depiction: A young goddess with a crescent moon in her hair
customProperties.Worshipers: Moon worshipers, druids, those who find solace in the night sky
customProperties.Sacred Places: Moonlit groves, serene lakes under moonlight, lunar observatories

entries: Lothwyn is the fledgling goddess of the moon, emerging as a symbol of the night sky and its mysteries. Those who revere her find solace in the serene glow of the moon and seek to explore the secrets of the night.

deity.name: Chuthlu
deity.title: The Great Demon
deity.symbol: A pentagram

customProperties.Depiction: A monstrous demon with tentacles and multiple eyes
customProperties.Worshipers: Cultists, dark sorcerers, those who revel in chaos and destruction
customProperties.Sacred Places: Cursed ruins, dark temples, forbidden sites of power

entries: Chuthlu is the great demon of chaos and destruction. It is a monstrous entity with tentacles and multiple eyes, spreading madness and chaos wherever it goes. Its worshipers seek to bring about the end of order and revel in the chaos it creates.

deity.name: Maraxus
deity.title: Oracle Demon
deity.symbol: An eye in a swirling vortex

customProperties.Depiction: A demonic entity with a swirling vortex for a body and a single eye at its center
customProperties.Worshipers: Seers, cultists, those who seek forbidden knowledge and prophecy
customProperties.Sacred Places: Dark sanctuaries, hidden libraries, ancient ruins

entries: Maraxus is the oracle demon, possessing forbidden knowledge and the power of prophecy. Its followers delve into dark mysteries and seek to unveil the secrets of the future, often at a terrible cost.

deity.name: Lolth
deity.title: Spider Demon
deity.symbol: A black widow spider

customProperties.Depiction: A monstrous spider with a dark, seductive allure
customProperties.Worshipers: Drow, arachnid cults, those who embrace treachery and cunning
customProperties.Sacred Places: Underground lairs, web-covered temples, shadowy caverns

entries: Lolth is the spider demon, a sinister entity with a dark, seductive allure. It lures its followers into treacherous webs of deceit and cunning, especially among the drow who venerate it.

deity.name: Termina
deity.title: Enforcer of Ascension Challenges
deity.symbol: A sword crossed with a gauntlet

customProperties.Depiction: A stoic figure bearing a sword and gauntlet
customProperties.Worshipers: Champions, adventurers, those who seek to prove their worth
customProperties.Sacred Places: Arena coliseums, challenge arenas, ancient battlegrounds

entries: Termina is the enforcer of ascension challenges, a stoic figure who oversees tests of strength, skill, and valor. Those who undertake challenges in the name of Termina seek to prove their worth and earn their place among the mighty.

deity.name: Korg
deity.title: King of the gods, God of Lightning, Thunder, and Justice
deity.symbol: A lightning bolt crossed with scales of justice

customProperties.Depiction: A regal figure holding a lightning bolt and scales of justice
customProperties.Worshipers: Kings, judges, champions of justice, those who seek protection from storms
customProperties.Sacred Places: Courthouses, temples of justice, mountaintop sanctuaries

entries: Korg is the King of the gods and the embodiment of lightning, thunder, and justice. He brings righteous fury to those who defy the laws of morality and stands as a protector against the fury of storms.

deity.name: Nalani
deity.title: Queen of the gods, Goddess of Marriage, Childbirth, and Fertility
deity.symbol: Two intertwined rings of light

customProperties.Depiction: A motherly figure surrounded by the aura of light and life
customProperties.Worshipers: Married couples, expectant mothers, farmers, those seeking love and fertility
customProperties.Sacred Places: Temples of love, fertile fields, birthing sanctuaries

entries: Nalani is the Queen of the gods, overseeing the domains of marriage, childbirth, and fertility. She blesses unions with love and brings the gift of life to the world.

deity.name: Pethaida
deity.title: God of the Sea, Earthquakes, and Horses
deity.symbol: A crashing wave with a horse emerging

customProperties.Depiction: A god riding a majestic sea horse, commanding the elements
customProperties.Worshipers: Sailors, equestrians, those who rely on the sea for sustenance
customProperties.Sacred Places: Coastal shrines, stables near the sea, earthquake-prone regions

entries: Pethaida is the god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses. He commands the might of the ocean, the earth's tremors, and the grace of horses. His blessings ensure safe voyages and bountiful harvests.

deity.name: Thainith
deity.title: Goddess of Wisdom, War, and Crafts
deity.symbol: A quill crossed with a sword and hammer

customProperties.Depiction: A wise warrior crafting a masterpiece of knowledge and war
customProperties.Worshipers: Scholars, warriors, craftsmen, those who seek wisdom and mastery
customProperties.Sacred Places: Libraries, war academies, craft guilds

entries: Thainith is the goddess of wisdom, war, and crafts. She represents the synergy between knowledge, martial prowess, and craftsmanship. Her guidance leads to strategic brilliance and artistic mastery.

deity.name: Solaria
deity.title: God of the Sun, Music, and Prophecy
deity.symbol: A radiant sun with musical notes

customProperties.Depiction: A radiant figure holding a sun-shaped lute
customProperties.Worshipers: Bards, musicians, seers, those who seek enlightenment
customProperties.Sacred Places: Music halls, temples of light, oracles' chambers

entries: Solaria is the god of the sun, music, and prophecy. The radiant warmth of the sun, the harmony of music, and glimpses into the future all fall under Solaria's benevolent influence.

deity.name: Orion
deity.title: Goddess of the Hunt, Wilderness, and Childbirth
deity.symbol: A bow and arrow crossed with a pregnant belly

customProperties.Depiction: A skilled huntress with a bow, surrounded by the wild and fertile land
customProperties.Worshipers: Hunters, wilderness explorers, expectant mothers, those who revere nature
customProperties.Sacred Places: Deep forests, birthing groves, hunting lodges

entries: Orion is the goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and childbirth. She embodies the cycles of life, from the hunt for sustenance to the miracle of birth, all within the embrace of the untamed wilderness.

deity.name: Zarin
deity.title: God of War
deity.symbol: Crossed swords

customProperties.Depiction: A formidable warrior wielding twin swords
customProperties.Worshipers: Soldiers, mercenaries, those who seek martial prowess
customProperties.Sacred Places: Battlefields, martial arenas, training grounds

entries: Zarin is the god of war, embodying the chaos and ferocity of battle. Warriors call upon his name for strength and victory in the heat of combat.

deity.name: Eros
deity.title: God of Wine, Celebration, and Fertility
deity.symbol: A goblet overflowing with wine

customProperties.Depiction: A jovial figure raising a goblet in celebration
customProperties.Worshipers: Winegrowers, revelers, those who seek merriment and fertility
customProperties.Sacred Places: Vineyards, festive plazas, celebration halls

entries: Eros is the god of wine, celebration, and fertility. His presence ensures bountiful harvests and joyous celebrations filled with merriment.

deity.name: Verin
deity.title: God of the Underworld
deity.symbol: A stylized gate to the underworld

customProperties.Depiction: A somber figure guarding the entrance to the underworld
customProperties.Worshipers: Mourners, those who seek guidance for the deceased, those who confront mortality
customProperties.Sacred Places: Mausoleums, necropolises, ancestral tombs

entries: Verin is the god of the underworld, overseeing the passage of souls to the afterlife. Those who revere him seek solace and guidance in the face of death's inevitability.

deity.name: Selune
deity.title: The Moon, Darkness, Illusion, and Mystery
deity.symbol: A crescent moon veiled in shadows

customProperties.Depiction: A mysterious figure shrouded in moonlight and shadows
customProperties.Worshipers: Mystics, illusionists, those who embrace the enigma of the night
customProperties.Sacred Places: Moonlit groves, hidden sanctuaries, shadowy realms

entries: Selune is the deity of the moon, darkness, illusion, and mystery. Her presence casts veils of shadows and intrigue over the world, attracting those who seek to unravel the secrets of the night.

deity.name: I'jin
deity.title: The Almiraj
deity.symbol: An almiraj horn

customProperties.Depiction: An elusive almiraj with gleaming horns
customProperties.Worshipers: Thieves, acrobats, those who seek dexterity
customProperties.Sacred Places: Hidden dens, acrobat's arenas, shadowy alleys

entries: I'jin, the Almiraj, bestows the gift of extreme dexterity upon those who invoke their name. This elusive deity is known for their nimbleness and stealth.

deity.name: Kubazan
deity.title: The Froghemoth
deity.symbol: A froghemoth's webbed claw

customProperties.Depiction: A mighty froghemoth with bulging muscles
customProperties.Worshipers: Warriors, strongmen, those who seek strength
customProperties.Sacred Places: Training grounds, arenas, swamps

entries: Kubazan, the Froghemoth, grants the power of immense strength to their followers. This mighty deity embodies raw physical power and endurance.

deity.name: Moa
deity.title: The Jaculi
deity.symbol: A jaculi coiled in invisibility

customProperties.Depiction: A graceful jaculi shrouded in invisibility
customProperties.Worshipers: Spies, infiltrators, those who seek invisibility
customProperties.Sacred Places: Secret hideouts, covert sanctuaries, shadowy realms

entries: Moa, the Jaculi, bestows the gift of invisibility upon their adherents. This graceful deity excels in stealth and covert operations.

deity.name: Nangnang
deity.title: The Grung
deity.symbol: A grung clinging to walls and ceilings

customProperties.Depiction: A nimble grung moving effortlessly on walls and ceilings
customProperties.Worshipers: Acrobats, climbers, those who seek mobility
customProperties.Sacred Places: Jungle canopy shrines, vertical caves, treacherous cliffs

entries: Nangnang, the Grung, imparts the gift of walking on ceilings and walls without needing one's hands. This nimble deity excels in mobility and acrobatics.

deity.name: Obo'laka
deity.title: The Zorbo
deity.symbol: A zorbo surrounded by magical items

customProperties.Depiction: A zorbo surrounded by mystical artifacts
customProperties.Worshipers: Mages, collectors, those who seek magical attunement
customProperties.Sacred Places: Arcane libraries, treasure vaults, mystical sanctuaries

entries: Obo'laka, the Zorbo, allows the host to attune to more magical items. This deity is associated with magic and the mysteries of arcane artifacts.

deity.name: Papazotl
deity.title: The Eblis
deity.symbol: A pair of alert eblis eyes

customProperties.Depiction: An eblis with keen eyes constantly scanning its surroundings
customProperties.Worshipers: Sentinels, scouts, those who seek heightened perception
customProperties.Sacred Places: Watchtowers, sentinel outposts, observatories

entries: Papazotl, the Eblis, grants the power of impossibly perceptive senses to their host. This deity excels in alertness and surveillance.

deity.name: Shagambi
deity.title: The Kamadan
deity.symbol: A kamadan poised for rapid attacks

customProperties.Depiction: A kamadan with multiple tails ready for combat
customProperties.Worshipers: Warriors, duelists, those who seek combat prowess
customProperties.Sacred Places: Battlefields, dueling arenas, martial academies

entries: Shagambi, the Kamadan, allows the host to make attacks in rapid succession. This deity excels in martial combat and swift strikes.

deity.name: Unkh
deity.title: The Flail Snail
deity.symbol: A flail snail shell with a sturdy constitution

customProperties.Depiction: A resolute flail snail with a tough, resilient shell
customProperties.Worshipers: Healers, endurance athletes, those who seek resilience
customProperties.Sacred Places: Sanctuaries of healing, endurance courses, fortified shelters

entries: Unkh, the Flail Snail, bestows the gift of very high tolerance and constitution. This deity embodies endurance and unwavering resilience.

deity.name: Wongo
deity.title: The Su-Monster
deity.symbol: A su-monster surrounded by psionic energy

customProperties.Depiction: A su-monster channeling raw psionic power
customProperties.Worshipers: Psychics, psionics, those who seek mental mastery
customProperties.Sacred Places: Psionic chambers, meditation sanctuaries, places of mental focus

entries: Wongo, the Su-Monster, imparts the ability of psionic power to the inhabited individual. This deity is associated with the raw force of mental prowess.

entries.name: Age
entries: The average lifespan of a Drakari is 500 years, but in some cases, they can live as long as 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The alignment of a Drakari varies based on the type of dragon they are based on.

entries.name: Quadrupedal
entries: Drakari are faster when walking on all fours. When walking on all fours, their walking speed is 40ft, but they can't hold anything in their hands. When walking on two legs, their walking speed is 25ft, but they can use their hands normally.

entries.name: Wings
entries: Drakari have a flying speed of 30ft.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Drakari count as one size larger when determining their carrying capacity and the weight they can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When making a melee attack on their turn, a Drakari's reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Draconic Darkvision
entries: A Drakari's vision evolves as they level up. At level 1, they have 60ft of Darkvision. At level 6, they gain 15ft of Blindsight. At level 11, they gain another 15ft of Blindsight, totaling 30ft of Blindsight. At level 16, they gain 15ft of True-sight.

entries.name: Unarmed Strikes
entries: Drakari can make a bite attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage once per turn instead of a normal unarmed strike. The rest of their unarmed strikes use their claws and deal 1d6 slashing damage.

entries.name: Charged Attacks
entries: As a Drakari, you can empower one of your unarmed strikes with extra damage based on your total class level. You also gain resistance to the type of damage your charged attack does. You can do this once per short or long rest.
Choose one of the following types of damage for your charged attack:
- Gray: Your unarmed strikes always hit a little harder and deal magical slashing or piercing damage. At level 1 (1d8), at level 6 (1d10), at level 11 (1d12), at level 16 (1d20).
- Purple: Fire (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Amethyst: Force (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Blue: Lightning (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Gold: Fire (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- White: Cold (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Black: Acid (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Copper: Acid (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Deep: Psychic (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Crystal: Radiant (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Emerald: Psychic (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Sapphire: Thunder (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Green: Poison (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Silver: Cold (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).
- Topaz: Necrotic (6d6), at level 6 (8d6), at level 11 (10d6), at level 16 (12d6).

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the Dargûl is destroyed, it reforms 1d6 days later at full hit points.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Dargûl can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Aura
entries: The Dargûl radiates an aura of darkness in a 5-foot radius. Any creatures that start their turn within this aura must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Shadow Resistance
entries: The Dargûl has advantage on saving throws against magical effects that would alter its form or appearance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Dargûl makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. And 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) Necrotic Damage.

action.name: Shadow Drain
entries: The Dargûl can use its action to drain the life force of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and the Dargûl gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and the Dargûl gains no temporary hit points.

action.name: (1/day) Shadow Strike
entries: The Dargûl becomes incorporeal and moves through solid objects for the next minute. It can also use its claw attack against any creature it moves through, and these attacks deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage.

Dargûl are sinister undead creatures, native to the shadowy realms of A'vealyn. They are known for their eerie ability to reform after being destroyed, their affinity for darkness, and their draining touch. Dargûl are often found lurking in places where shadows reign, seeking to spread fear and despair.

These creatures have a supernatural connection to the shadow plane, allowing them to become incorporeal at will. When in this form, they can move through solid objects and strike with deadly precision. The touch of a Dargûl drains the life force of its victims, making them even more formidable opponents.

Legends say that Dargûl were once mortals who delved too deeply into forbidden shadow magic, and as a result, they were cursed with undeath. Whether these tales are true or not, encountering a Dargûl is a terrifying experience, and it's best to avoid them whenever possible.

monster.name: Elemental of Fate
languages: understands the companion but can't speak

trait.name: Elemental Bond
entries: The Elemental of Fate is bound to a specific creature and cannot be controlled by anyone else. It can communicate telepathically with its bonded creature over any distance on the same plane of existence.

Appearance: The Elemental of Fate appears as a shimmering figure composed of radiant energy, surrounded by an aura of swirling threads of fate. Its form constantly shifts and changes, giving the impression that it is not entirely bound by the physical world. NOTE: Only the bonded character can see the Elemental of Fate. It can not be targeted by enemies. The only way for it to take damage is AOE.

ability.name: EACH LONG REST
entries: Choose two of the following effects to be active for the day:

subtrait.name: Foresight
entries: The Elemental of Fate grants its bonded creature the ability to glimpse into the future. The bonded creature gains advantage on Initiative rolls.

subtrait.name: True Sight
entries: The Elemental of Fate grants its bonded creature the ability to see the true nature of things. The bonded creature can see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic, out to 15ft.

subtrait.name: Shared Fortune
entries: The Elemental of Fate's presence brings fortune to its bonded creature. The bonded creature gains advantage on saving throws against effects that would cause it to be charmed or frightened.

subtrait.name: Guiding Touch
entries: The Elemental of Fate can touch its bonded creature, granting them guidance in their actions. Once per day, the bonded creature can reroll an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and must use the new roll.

subtrait.name: Resonance of Destiny
entries: The Elemental of Fate can empower its bonded creature's attacks with the resonance of fate. The bonded creature's attacks deal an additional 1d6 force damage.

subtrait.name: Blessing of Evasion
entries: The Elemental of Fate grants its bonded creature the ability to nimbly dodge out of the way of danger. The bonded creature gains the Evasion feature, allowing it to take no damage on a successful Dexterity saving throw against effects that normally deal half damage on a successful save.

subtrait.name: Fate's Insight
entries: The elemental provides constant insights to its bonded companion. The companion has advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information related to history, religion, and arcana.

action.name: Fate's Ward (Recharge 6)
entries: The Elemental of Fate creates a protective barrier around its bonded creature. The bonded creature gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws for 1 round.

monster.name: Time Elemental
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but can't speak

trait.name: Elemental Form
entries: The time elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The time elemental's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). The elemental can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: (2/day) If the time elemental fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The time elemental has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive Time
entries: The time elemental can take one reaction on every creature's turn, rather than only one reaction on its own turn.

trait.name: Time Warp
entries: Once per day, the elemental can use a bonus action to enter a state of temporal flux for 1 minute. During this time, the elemental has advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks, and can take an extra action on each of its turns. Additionally, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the elemental must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be affected by the slow spell for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The time elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Temporal Distortion (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The time elemental causes a ripple in time and space, affecting a 60-foot cube centered on itself. Each creature within the area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the slow spell for 1d4-2 rounds. The elemental can't use this ability again until it finishes a short or long rest.

item.name: Belt of Chaos Giant Strength
entries: This thick leather belt is adorned with swirling patterns in black and red that seem to shift and change as if alive. While wearing this belt, your strength score changes to 30, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
You can wield weapons that require 2 hands as if they had the versatile property, allowing you to use them one-handed if you choose.
You deal an extra 2d6 damage with melee attacks that use your Strength.

entries: Additionally, the belt has a chaotic nature that can lead to unexpected consequences. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a Strength check or attack roll, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, the belt of chaos giant strength becomes unstable and loses its magic for 1d4 rounds. During this time, your strength score returns to its original value, and you lose the benefits of the belt. On a roll of 11-20, the chaotic energy surges through you, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your level plus your Strength modifier. The belt of chaos giant strength remains stable in this case.
